summary.Title: Orthoptist
summary.Presentation: Østfold Hospital is one of Europe's most high-tech and innovative hospitals and offers specialist health services in somatics and mental health care for more than 300,000 inhabitants in Vestby and

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Østfold Hospital is one of Europe's most high-tech and innovative hospitals and offers specialist health services in somatics and mental health care for more than 300,000 inhabitants in Vestby and Østfold in Viken county. Our main tasks are treatment of patients, research and education.

With over 5,000 employees, the foundation for success of the hospital is based on the expertise and committed professional environment at the hospital. The organization have a common goal of providing the patients with a comprehensive, world leading and caring health service, with the patient in focus.

Østfold Hospital is located in a state-of-the-art hospital in Kalnes and in a newly renovated and updated hospital in Moss. In addition, there are prehospital services at different services locations, within mental health care, in close proximity to where the patients live. From all our locations you are never far away from the coastline, wilderness or the Norwegian countryside.

Job description:

We want to strengthen our department with an orthoptist in a 100% permanent position.

The eye department at Østfold Hospital treats most eye diseases and takes care of assessment, diagnostics, medical and surgical treatment. We have modern operating rooms in connection with our outpatient clinic. In January, we opened an injection clinic where we treat AMD patients.

The eye department works to provide high quality eye health services to those who need it at the right time. Our employees have extensive experience, are very dedicated and always have the patient in focus. We are an interdisciplinary team of doctors, specialist nurses/nurses who collaborate across occupational groups.

As an orthoptist, you will work in an interdisciplinary team with a doctor and another experienced orthoptist while at the same time being given the opportunity to work independently with your patients. The eye department is located in modern newly renovated premises in Moss. The current work schedule is day shift. According to the Public Access to Information Act, information about the applicant may be publicly published, even if the applicant has requested not to be included on the applicant list.

We ask all applicants to enclose documentation of education and certificates of work experience. This is to document qualifications that appear in the CV, and for salary determination. All work from the age of 18 is relevant when calculating seniority.

Tasks:

  • Independent work as an orthoptist
  • Pre- and postoperative care of strabismus patients
  • Care of botox patients receiving treatment
  • Amblyope treatment
  • Neurophthalmological patients

Skills:

  •  Publicly approved orthoptist from education recognized by the IOA
  • English knowledge

Personal abilities:

  • Commitment to their profession and a genuine desire to lift the department further.
  • Open and confident personality, who has the ability to establish themselves in Norway.
  • Collaborate across occupational groups
  • Working hours and place of work We offer:
  • Independent work in an established team of doctors and an orthoptist in a part-time position
  • A good working environment across the occupational groups
  • Further education, participation in international congresses that are relevant to the subject
  • 37.5 hours working week (08.00-15.30)
  • Wage in accordance with agreement
  • Language course
  • Help with questions aimed at immigration and residence in Norway

Østfold /Viken offers a wide range of cultural offerings and has good flight connections nearby.

https://www.visitoestfold.com/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fkM6IMMMkWo&feature=youtu.be

Regardless of whether you are a recent graduate or have long experience, we look forward to hearing from you.
